author: {'steamid': '76561198119344648', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1710809412}
review: This is the first Tower Defense game that I've played so far, and I only really got it because I had a coupon for it. To me, it's a little bland, but a decent time waster. You shoot dinosaurs and defend your base with four different weapon types (one of which is not a weapon at all, but a bone collector). That's pretty much it. It's okay.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1705775127}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happineass of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1687785025}
review:
Day D: Tower Rush is a basic mobile-app like tower defense game.  This is copy + pasted from the same basic TD asset and reskinned by the serial offenders at Creobit, who continually copy + paste the same game templates onto Steam... something they've done literally hundreds of times.  This guy is a major polluter.

The developer, Creobit/8Floor, has copy + pasted this game 7 times onto Steam with minor reskins... why cash in on one asset if you can cash in on multiple copies of the same game? Asset flipping begins at home! Here's a list of Creobit's copy + pastes of this asset:

[list]
[*] Day D: Tower Rush (this game)
[*] Fort Defense
[*] Gnumz: Masters of Defense
[*] Iron Heart
[*] Iron Sea Defenders
[*] Medieval Defenders
[*] Royal Defense
[/list]

[i]These are all reskins of exactly the same game![/i]  What value is there in this spam/pollution glutting the Steam store for gamers?

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no options to change the resolution for the game or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality graphics. 

This looks and feels like a mobile app, but it doesn't seem to have made it to the app stores.  It's unclear why this was put on Steam instead of the app stores it seems to have been designed for.  Maybe it was removed, maybe it was rejected by Apple and Google (they do have more rigorous quality standards than Valve does for Steam, after all).

Regardless, for all intents and purposes this might as well be a mobile app, it has the same limitations and dumbed down qualities.  It's impossible to recommend such a game to PC gamers.  We don't spend all this money building gaming rigs so we can pretend they're iPhones and play games that might as well be mobile apps.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

You don't have to take my word about how bad the game is, we can measure the interest in a game by how much people bothered to play it.  Day D: Tower Rush has achievements, and they show us a very clear picture that the game absolutely failed to capture any interest from gamers.  The most commonly and easily attained achievement is for filling up a map with different towers (you can do that on the first level), but less than 8 percent of players bothered to get that far before uninstalling the game.  That's a tiny, tiny proportion of gamers who even bothered with this.  Ouch.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this isn't consistent with the achievement stats, that show less than 8 percent of players bothered playing the game for any reasonable amount of time.  How is it possible for this game to have so many concurrent players who weren't even playing the game?  Trading cards.  Players will use card idling software to collect the cards and sell them, but this won't trigger any achievements in-game.  That tells us people only really bought this game for trading cards, and that's a damning indictment of the woeful quality.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

1001 Jigsaw Castles And Palaces has the farcical price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561199072961747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1676242670}
review: One of the worst tower defense games I've ever played. I do not recommend this game because of the clumsy mechanics and the feckless upgrades. I wasn't expecting this to be the best tower defense I've played - but after multiple crashes and playing through several levels (I found myself getting annoyed and leaving it paused) I decided to write a review and tell others to save their time - this game is a pass.  The upgrades seem almost meaningless - I tried different approaches but even when throwing all points into powering up one type of tower - it doesn't seem to do more damage from upgrade to upgrade. Even worse, micro-maneuvering of towers and redirecting their focus is near impossible - enemies still pass and towers  shoot wherever they please.  I play tower defense because it's mindless and peaceful but this game had me frustrated. If you're looking for a relaxing tower defense try one of 8 Floor's other titles or better yet any of Iron Hide (Kingdom Rush or Iron Marines are great).

review:
Um jogo mal acabado que parece mais um porte mal feito de celulares.

Um Tower Defense que com mÃºltiplas habilidades mas sem NENHUMA tecla de atalho.

Torres que atacam aleatoriamente, sem priorizar inimigos prÃ³ximos, ou mais prÃ³ximos da saÃ­das, nÃ£o te permitindo ter domÃ­nio do "campo de batalha". Ã‰ possÃ­vel "focar" em unidades, mas nÃ£o funciona bem.

E uma grande quantidade de mapas, por vezes repetidos e necessitando ser vencidos uma vez em cada dificuldade (fÃ¡cil, normal, difÃ­cil) para ir acumulando "pontos" e com isso evoluir as torres e habilidades.

E a cereja no topo do bolo Ã© nÃ£o ser possÃ­vel rodar em segundo plano, o que te impede de jogÃ¡-lo em paralelo com outras atividades e ir acumulando os pontos, que acabam funcionando como uma barreira ao progresso no jogo.

[In English] - Translation to help my foreign friends understand

[h1] Difficult but easy tower defense[/h1]

It is a casual tower defense game. Most of them are dinosaurs, but sometimes insect-like ones also appear. 
It's not difficult to stop the incoming enemies, but it's not easy to get 3 stars and clear it. 
Depending on the stage, some strategy is required.

The reason I thought of 'difficult but easy tower defense' is simple.
It is not easy to get 3 stars and clear the stage once you get past stage 10. 
However, achievements are not related to the number of stages cleared or the number of stars obtained.

It's not an impressive game, but it's a mediocre game. 
I do recommend the fact to be on the discount.

review: Bueno.. otro clon de defensa de torres pero con dinosaurios , el precio no es caro, y en oferta muy barato y con cromos, a mi en particular no me gustan estos tipos de juegos pero muy casualmente no es de lo peor del mundo, podria estar mejor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972418400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1617132589}
review:
This game is a lot tougher than fort defense from the same developer. Playing on easy i got stuck somewhere around the mid point, i was forced to play the duplicate normal and hard levels to earn enough points in the workshop to unlock more of the bonus's to help you get through certain levels. So yes bit of a grind but i was fine with that.
The game cost 39p so i can have zero complaints.
One weird thing though is the achievements, you can actually have them all unlocked while only half way through the game, not a big problem but worth noting if you like to be driven by in game achievements.
Solid little tower defense

author: {'steamid': '76561198039760439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1184, 'last_played': 1699376802}
review: I love this game right up until level 15/16 and you just cannot progress further.  Ridiculously hard even if you have it set on easy.  Devs need to look at the game play and scale things more intelligently.  Make the Easy setting EASY, just so annoyed I paid for what is ostensibly a 16 level game.  Would not rercommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198017426654', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1600688342}
review: Creobit is a developer that apparently does not use game testers, utilizing the end user for testing instead. I have been playing their catalog of tower defense games in the order of release date. The previous entries didn't even have the towers balanced, you would end up playing with a single tower with one specific upgrade for the entire game. This game (while using the exact same 4 towers and their upgrades as the games before it) manages to find that balance. The implications being that this is the third upgrade to the core mechanics, and each upgrade is just sold as a separate game with a different theme. You would probably regret buying any of the previous games for more than 50 cents (when you realize you are being used for testing, and you are paying them instead the other way around). This balance, however, comes with a cost: the game is extremely difficult. I can already see the next adjustments they will apply.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036895977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 20087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1636527608}
review:
Updated Review
Initially I was unimpressed by this game, but I stuck with it. After playing another 169 hours, I've come to realize it's rather brilliant. The issue I am currently having is that I have been able to achieve 3 stars on all dificulty levels for the campaigns that are open. The remaining campaigns, Ice Age and beyond, are still locked. 

The secret to this game is to play it until you get  enough DNA to upgrade things. I decided to upgrade the weapons first and the special buttons second. That was a game changer for me, and the better the weapons became, the more fun the game was. 

Ergo, I recomend this game. It's wonderful! It's a bit of a slow burn, but it is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1586014078}
review:
[h1] Information  [/h1]

Day D: Tower Rush ist ein Tower Defense, welches von Creobit entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay  [/h1]

Wie in jedem Tower Defense, muss man seine TÃ¼rme hoch leveln. Allerdings verÃ¤ndern sich die TÃ¼rme nur sehr selten am Aussehen. Die Maps wiederholen sich mit der Zeit und Gegnertypen gibt es auch sehr wenige.  Durch Verbesserungen lassen sich TÃ¼rme, Magie und Anfangsboni freischalten. 

[h1] Pro: [/h1]

+ Dinosauriersetting 
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra: [/h1]

- langweiliges Gameplay
- kurze Spielzeit
- wenig Gegnertypen

[h1] Fazit: [/h1]

Wer in Day D: Tower Rush ein gutes Tower Defense-Spiel erwartet, wird es hier nicht finden und enttÃ¤uscht sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198893329311', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1649783631}
review:
AT A GLANCE:
     5/5 Stars - Fun, and entertaining! I really like this game not just for myself. but for the whole family. Simple, yet strategic game. Great tower defense to check out.

GAME GENRE:
     Single player, Tower Defense, Casual, Strategy, Family Friendly, Point & Click, 

GAME DESCRIPTION:
     Release Date: July 2016 - Help the professor get back to his time. Fight off huge waves of dinosaurs that are trying to destroy the professors time machine.

KID FRIENDLY:
     (First know that I am very strict on kid approved material. A game with a standard rating of "PG" I might rate "PG-13". These are my ratings and have nothing to do with standard ratings)

     I rate this "PG". Great strategy game for kids to figure out. Might also be a little challenging, and the cartoonish graphics will also be a hit for them.

ACHIEVEMENTS:
     12 Achievements ranging from easy to moderate to obtain.

TRADING CARDS:
     5 Trading cards

PROS:
     -Challenging
     -Hours of fun
     -Fun graphics
     -Great weapon towers

CONS:
     -Could be more added to the story

GAMEPLAY:
     The gameplay is good being a Point & Click game.
     
VISUAL EFFECTS:
     Cartoonish graphics, and visual effects are fun.

AUDIO:
     More of a dramatic, suspense type of music, which goes really good with the game. The sound effects fit what is going on in the game.

STORYLINE:
     Good simple storyline. There could have been more added to the story, but it works.

REPLAY VALUE:
     Absolutely! Fun game!

PROBLEMS/ISSUES:
     None - No problems installing game. No issues during start up. No game freezes, or unexpected quitting.

WORDS FOR DEVELOPERS:
     Really good family fun game. Thank you!

CURATOR:
     If you like my reviews please follow my Curator page. Thank you! :)
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37878480/

review: Fun little tower defense game. I say little because of its relative simplicity of gameplay, though there are a ton of levels to play and the research mechanic as you play through them makes you a bit stronger with every win. If you like completing all the achievements for a game, this one I did in 3.4 hours of gameplay, but there is still plenty of content I haven't gotten to yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240530076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1662975098}
review:
Don't bother until on sale.

It becomes somewhat hard even on "Easy" difficulty in later levels. Hovewer, with some micromanagement (frequent pauses, clicking on an enemy to make it priority target) it becomes more manageable.

You have to use trial-and-error method to learn how to play, because the comments are not enough. Also you cannot review them if you forget, you have to play particular level to see them again.
You cannot easily compare the towers, so you have to guess which one is actually better for given position. It is somewhat grindy to get upgrades to allow progression.

It is not bad, but could be much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323260530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1610761074}
review:
This is a pretty good game.  It has all the elements of this genre of tower defense games.  I found it way too difficult to be enjoyable for the long run.  Even the "easy" mode got too hard to finish.  I had to go back to the early games and play  the "normal" and "hard" versions just to get some more stars to upgrade the weapons.  This works but it makes the game very tedious.  Once a world is finished, the next one starts with easier games so you can build up some more stars to upgrade with.  It goes like that - boot-strapping.   The game is  inexpensive so it is worth a try - you may like it  better than I did.  

It doesn't compare  well with some of the best games in this genre such as the Kingdom Rush Series, or Evil Defenders.  Those games have much more artistic and complex graphics, and a game play that is balanced - not easy and not that difficult to make progress.  On a scale of 1-10 I would rank the above mentioned games at 10, maybe a 9.  This game - Day D: Tower Rush,  I would rank at 6 in comparison.

It has a few achievements that are mostly fulfilled as you play the game.  A couple of them require special effort, but that too is very easy.  So you can get the achievements, but may not get far on the games. That is a bit strange that it has easy achievements but very difficult games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971202050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1565894726}

You have the obvious types of defense which you can upgrade.
Everything you ever seen from a defense game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330888468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1567067235}
review:
A badly put together effort to milk your pockets, without even offering a fun experience in the process.
The game has a cute look, though it is super light in the fluff department, which is pretty important in creating a sense of engagement. 
The controls are wonky, I often find I have clicked on the wrong tower or spot, without any indicator, even when I click right on the tower itself.
The animation is bargain basement. To be fair, the creator of the sprites did an excellent job, but they only apparently paid for facing left and facing right, so when they are moving towards or away from you, they look really bad.
There is an upgrade system which seems pretty standard, though without a way to reset them, if you make a bad choice, you are pretty much screwed. You can occassionally get a new upgrade point here or there, but with no consistency, and I have no clue even what makes it happen. Too slow to really make much of a difference. 
I do recommend that if you play this, ignore the high-points that you have to use upgrade points to unlock, they seem a really bad investment. 
I feel things are, all in all, under-explained as well.
 I ran into a brick wall on level 15, and the comments make it seem like this is pretty common. (The level had a short cut which on most levels only the smaller dinosaurs can use it, but for some reason here even larger ones start using it, and overwhelm me. Not sure if this is a glitch or not, but the developer doesn't seem to have responded to the problem.)
The developer seems to be focused on creating new levels, levels that (a) many of us cant even get to and (b) that he wants to charge for. 
All in all, a lackluster effort. Traditionally I would finish the story mode anyway, but as mentioned, I can't. Going to actually uninstall, a shocker for me at this stage, and a true measure of my disappointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052707118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1549399746}
review:
A rather dull reinvention (or should i better say reskin?) of always the same game engine from this developer.

The enemy waves are very unbalanced. To get three star rating in every level you have to grind A LOT, wich meanchs playing the same boring levels over and over and over and over and over again. The loading takes forever and the loading screen itself is still in a 4:3 ratio. The backgrounds are completely static and the animation of the enemies is overly simple. The music sounds like 8 Bit or 12 Bit in sound quality and there is only a handfull of sound effects.

Why would you play this, when you can play any of the Kingdom Rush series?

The only positive about it is that achievements are relatively easy to accomplish. 50% of them can be done in the first level and you will get all of them soon before even thinking about completing the whole game. This itself is no achievement. Thank god.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032649576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 687, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1699482713}
review:
Colossal garbage.
You don't even have to finish the game to get the achievements, it shows how much effort is put into this game.
The balance is disgusting the levels become extremely difficult even the easiest level suddenly.
Upgrades barely give you strength and the points for them are quite small and only once per level. And you can't get your points back, so the purchase is permanent.
There is an upgrade that gives you more points when you start, but in some levels you start with almost no points.
The levels must be passed on a special path, not freely like most such games. Another stupid thing in the game.
There are enemies that stop your towers and you will hardly be able to stop them and other creatures have more advantage than your towers.
The game has potential, but in this situation it is complete garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971490143', 'num_games_owned': 1321, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1540847466}
review:
Boring, bland mobile port.  
It works, but is no fun to play. Difficulty ramps up quickly. And looking at the other ratings, it all becomes a grind. Grinding is already one of the worst game "mechanics", but if a game doesn't even motivate you to do it, it's just garbage.

Graphics are low quality. No high resolution. Lack of animation on the enemies.

EDIT: Garbage game also created 1.5GB "log" file in 3.7h playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975373553', 'num_games_owned': 1873, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1525249308}
review:
While looking better than previous tower defenses from the same developer/publisher, the most disappointing aspect of this game is that it's a shameless re-skin of previous games from same dev. (Fort defense, Royal defense, Iron sea and more(?))  

Same identical boring arithmetic upgrade system as previous games. No improvements has been made to obvious things like hotkeys (spells), or menu silliness (not being able to back out map list after completing a map). No creativity here at all. 

3 hours in (not even half-way through the maps) and already at 100% achievements. (I call that an unfinished.)

Having this kind of content broken up into [i]expensive[/i] DLC-pieces is insulting. 

Selling the same game over and over again with mostly graphical changes is like giving the finger to any repeat customers.

If you have not played the previous games, then I guess this game is not as awful, but you should probably still [b]stay away[/b] for the poor business practice alone.

After Gnumz (the most original towerdef from this dev), I was hoping for an upswing in creativity at the very least. But no, back to poop-tier. Congrats! :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198256291224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1522354436}
review:
Average TD, a re-skinned Iron Sea Defenders (or vice versa) with the exact same towers, upgrades, creeps and abilities. Nothing special, however, I recommend Iron Sea Defenders over this one. In comparison:

- The Day D animations are sometimes awkward, with dinosaurs walking sideways. Doesn't happen with ships.
- On several levels, the tower slots that have to be unlocked with I-Volve (or Anchor) currency are bugged and can't be used, which makes some levels quite annoying. Didn't happen in Iron Sea Defenders.
- Doesn't actually have the levels it claims to have. At least Iron Sea is honest about them being DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034315837', 'num_games_owned': 7748, 'num_reviews': 765, 'playtime_forever': 1518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1563178117}
review:
This TD is a pretty solid if mechanically generic entry into the well, frankly, overs-saturated field that this genre occupies. Still, it's good fun for anyone that gets a kick out of the theme and the 2D artwork is crisp, detailed and is overall nicely animated. The achievements are very easy to 100% if you're into that as well. One thing to note that it's obviously a mobile port and as such there seems to be no keyboard shortcuts so it plays as a mouse only affair.

Serviceable TD with all the common trappings of the genre but with enough variety to satisfy those that crave yet another game where you get to shoot at critters that have the audacity to get from point A to B.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043863729', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1515593522}
review:
This is a solid example of the tower defense genre. It's not genre-defining, or even particularly innovative, but if you enjoy tower defense games, then you should like this one. I like the art style, and the gameplay is simple and pretty balanced, with a variety of towers and lots of upgrades to help you keep up with the waves of dinosaurs.

I do wish that the little story blurbs and/or new tower explanations didn't come up every single time I replayed a level. Clicking to open up a tower's upgrade menu sometimes opens up a nearby tower's menu instead when they are too close, which isn't usually a big problem, except when the speed is at the highest setting. It seems like you have to click the base of the tower. If the top of the front tower overlaps the bottom of the back tower, clicking on the top of the front tower opens up the back one.

It would also be nice if the game had a little more "extra" content. The story is pretty bare-bones, which is fine for a tower defense, but even so, it's a bit hard to understand what is there. The opening shows you some kind of explosion, leaving you and your robot trapped in the past. It's not clear why you were going to the past in the first place nor how you're progressing toward fixing your time machine between each tower defense level. Also, it would be cool to have a bestiary where you could look up all the dinosaurs you've encountered so far in the story with their speed and health, and a similar listing of the towers you've unlocked, with their base range and damage.

I've had a good time playing it, and don't feel bad recommending it, despite the shortcomings. That said, if you're on the fence about getting this one, I also don't feel bad about saying you should probably wait till it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006260288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1523758587}
review:
A good honest Tower Defence.

Nothing that we have not seen before, but it has a level of challenge is fairly high and will keep you more than occupied on the higher levels.

Don't be afraid to use the pause button as you can quickly accumulate cash that might be helpful for the wave you are playing.

â–Œâ–“â–“â–“â–„â–„â–€â–€â–“â–“â–“â–€â–“â–“â–“â–“â–“â–“â–“â–“â–ˆâ–“â–ˆâ–“â–ˆâ–“â–“â–Œâ–ˆâ–Œ
â–ˆâ–â–“â–“â–“â–“â–“â–“â–„â–„â–„â–“â–“â–“â–“â–“â–“â–ˆâ–“â–ˆâ–“â–ˆâ–“â–ˆâ–“â–“â–“â–â–ˆ

[h1]Overall Review[/h1]

I'm not good at this game. I admit. But for real. This is might be close to the [b]"Dark Souls"[/b] of [i]tower defense[/i] game. Note that I played this game at "Easy" difficulty. The horde is unthinkable. The gap between is too fast. Here's 2 things I'm concerned about:

1. The upgrade system of each weapon is trying to be fair but ended up being not. Every upgrade you make is going to [b]increase[/b] the damage while also [b]decrease[/b] the fire rate. Not so good if the upcoming waves are full with super fast tiny raptor or just an unreachable flying pterodactyl.
2. The Workshop. Oh God. It is not reversible. Once a wrong decision is made, it stays. For the rest of the game. The end.

It's actually not bad. I was expecting a fun game within Day D: Tower Rush but instead it's slowly turn into a quite stressful one. If [i]"fun"[/i] means grinding and learning to master a tower defense type of game to you then suit yourself. Either way I'm still recommending this game. Try it out first and let me know. 

[h1]PROs (& CONs)[/h1]

+ Cool weaponry (for a dinosaur age) with different abilities.
-  the difficulty

author: {'steamid': '76561198044797961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 1930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1930, 'last_played': 1512802893}
review: A good little Tower Defense game. The graphics and effects are pretty decent and maps are very colorfull, but requires run with compatibility with an old windows version to go fine. The mechanics is exactly the same than Port Defense and Royal Defense. Challenge is very good calculated, and player should to use all types of towers and special weapons to win perfectly, a rare thing in the genre. The DLC are well. To complete all campaigns in all difficulty modes with 100 % of achievements takes about 32 hours. Recommend specially for children and to introduce newbies in the genre. Maybe is the best tower defense game of the series made by this developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167940370', 'num_games_owned': 1417, 'num_reviews': 700, 'playtime_forever': 1749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1721, 'last_played': 1509448575}
review:
Day D: Tower Rush

Day D Tower Rush is not a game that is jammed full of extra content like PixelJunk Monsters Ultimate HD is by any stretch of the imagination. Unlike the aforementioned title, Day D Tower Rush lacks any multiplayer, medal challenges, or ad-hoc play. That said, it is also less than half the cost of the that game, so if you don't care about those features then you could in theory get a competent tower defense game on the cheap.

As much as I enjoy this, the game unfortunately has its issues that could be quite annoying to some people and make the extra cost to avoid or the simple savings of not getting involved the better choice.

review:
Standard mobile port of one of worst genres ever - Tower Defense.
People keep doing them in wrong way, that's why I say it's "bad genre". 

No keyboard adaptation and overlooped music (overused*) is really painful.
Graphics are okay - it's pretty standard, that those games come with nice 2D graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198390668448', 'num_games_owned': 1316, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1603368135}
review:
I saw that most of the other reviews main complaint is that it is a "run of the mill" tower defense game. That is probably true, although for me it is the first i played of that type, and i am not here to judge the game for its originality anyway.

I played the first 5 levels, on easy mode. Not the most exciticing game on earth, but for what it is, it's well-made and it does the job. I guess as the game progresses the challenge and "puzzles" will become more interesting and hard. I will certainly play more of it.

Is it the best tower defense game out there though? I have no idea, and honestly i don't care, as i prefer other types of games more.

Recommended? Sure, yes. Especially if you are into tower defense games, and not a die-hard of "originality" for the newer games of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058552427', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1502288834}
review:
First of all, if you are looking for a relaxing and casual tower defense experience, be warned! This game is HARD, even on the easy difficulty. That is all fine, but the problem is that it is not really a fun experience. Boring enemies, boring towers. The points you spend can not be refunded and put elsewhere into the "talent tree", so if you make the wrong choices early game you will be utterly destroyed later in the game, as me and others have experienced on level 15, but with no way to fix it other than start over on another save from the beginning.

The only positive thing is that the achievements are super easy to 100%.

Save yourself some money and buy another tower defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999086625', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1522223272}
review:
I wasn't really sure about Day D: Tower Rush but I decided to pick it up during the Steam Summer Sale since it was cheap. And as I played it, the game grew on me. It starts out simple but then it starts getting tougher as the maps go along.

I have to admit, I was eventually swayed by the "cuteness" of the game. A cartoonish version of a Jurassic Park Tower Defense game is my best description of this game.

I know some people might criticize the game but the elements, the graphics, the cartoony look, etc. It works. You have to think in this game. It is a strategy game at the heart of it all.

I wished that the graphics were a bit better at higher resolution on a larger monitor but for what I paid for Day D: Tower Rush, I got more than my money's worth out of this game. And I am not even finished.

Even if I quit playing from this point forward, I got my $1.25 worth of value out of the entertainment. But I will be back and I will probably pick up the DLC's when they go on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044727554', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1909, 'last_played': 1562321941}
review:
I never thought I would write a review for this game. Actually, I never thought I would ever play this game. I bought this as part of a game bundle which I actually bought for the sake of different games. And well, as it comes, out of boredom I decided to try this game one day, because tower defence games can be kind of neat.

[h1] The positive [/h1]

This game has quite a bit for you to do. And it is definitely not easy! Which I definitely see as a challenge, and challenges and difficult games are always fun. The sheer tension of when a massive horde of dinos are storming at your gate, while you are at wave 7 or 8, your gate is still at max health, and not a single dino has smashed into your gate yet, and you have to hit the [i]stop button[/i] every five second because the dinos get so damn close to your gate that it almost makes you pull your hair! And you've been sitting on this one level for half an hour or even and hour trying to get through it with full health and to earn 3 stars! When the last dino gets through and ruin your 3 stars it sure can make you jump up in rage and frustration. But once you finally make it, and you beat the level, you really feel relieve and accomplishment! And all the rage just peals off, which was never a negative rage. More of a fun and tense rage because you really want to beat that level.

And after 10 hours, that's how long it took me to get through the first act of the game, I all the sudden realized, this whole time i was playing and raging, i have only been playing on [b]easy[/b]! Well then, looks like the real challenge has yet to come.

Buying upgrades and trying to figure out which combination of turrets work out for you to master the level is fun. You can not only upgrade your turrets, but also your special abilities that you get more and more off with time. And also you can upgrade how much starting budged you have, and how much currency you get from killing dinos, as well as your gate health. Which you don't really need with you want to make it through with full health anyway.

My game also automatically contained all DLC, so with the DLC, there really is a lot to do if you want to get 100%.

[h1]The negative[/h1]

To be honest, there is really not all that much negative about this game. Just two things that come to my mind right now. One would be that (at least in the first act) there wasn't much varity of music. It starts repeating itself quickly, and get's a little dull. But i suppose you can just turn it off and listen to your own stuff.

One major thing though that has been especially negative in my mind is that turrets aren't able to prioritize. Which leands to many occasions where the turrest next to your gate, will fire at the dinos on the other lane, which is on the opposite side of the gate, and it will end up letting dinos get through where they shouldn't.
Although this can be seen as additional challenge, because you do have the ability to manually target dions, and tell you turrest what to fire at. So, you will end up pausing the game when there are too many enemies, and some could get trhough, so you can prioritize on those who are closest. And while it is a challenge, and adds to the tension sometimes, i more often felt it to be a negative frustration when enemies smash the gate, because then you earily end up blaming the game, instead of realizing it was your own fault. I would say in this case it'd be a shared fault. But personally i would rather the turrest to be a little smarter, and be able to prioritize.

[h1]Conclution[/h1]

It's a very solid game, which can be a lot of fun, as well as challenging frustration. If you wait for a sale, or find it in a bundle, and you can see yourself to just sit back and casually play a game that only requires you to use a mouse once in a while, this game will sure pay off for it's money in fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035560545', 'num_games_owned': 3970, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1476540968}
review:
This is another run of the mill tower defense, except it has dinosaurs.

The content is rather sparse and lacks imagination overall. You have arrow and cannon towers, they are now just made out of dinosaurs bones and such. After levels you can spend points to upgrade various aspects of towers/powers/stats, and the upgrades are all pretty standard "upgrade damage by X%," or "Reduce cost by X%," so it's all fairly safe. As others have pointed out, DLC is required to get the full experience (I received my copy with DLC included from a bundle).

Ultimately I can't recommend this tower defense when there are other TDs that are more engaging and interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988012862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1476354100}
review:
First impression: tower defense done well. [i](bundle purchase)[/i]

I've played 2 hours and beaten 5 levels, on easy, medium, and hard, and they're turning into quite a challenge even on easy. There are actually 80 levels (40 in the base game, 20 in each DLC). The game starts with a single tower type and a single enemy type, but progresses quickly from there. If you're not used to this genre, it's going to get frustrating quickly, but it's perfect if you have played tower defense before - there's no easy tutorial to wade through, yet you can pick it up quickly.

Some small complaints: the game is mostly silent on statistics such as fire rate or damage; there seems to be no in-game way to find out what my towers' stats (or the enemy's) actually are. I also did not see a way to reset the upgrade investments (and they can't be grinded). Choose wisely! The game is locked to 1280x720 and mouse only.

If you're looking for a decent tower defense game with a challenge, this is it.

[i]This game runs well on my old Windows XP computer.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498126', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1474307123}
review:
Wie immer ein sehr schÃ¶nes Tower Defense Spiel aus der Serie.

Im Prinzip sind es ja immer nur neue Settings und einige andere Maps, aber wenn man mehr als ein TD Spiel herausbringt, dann kann man das Rad ja auch nicht neu erfinden. Wenn es SpaÃŸ macht udn nicht langweilig wird, was will man mehr?
Nun gut, da wÃ¤re schon etwas. Die Engine kÃ¶nnte wirklich mal Ã¼berholt werden und zumindest hÃ¶here AuflÃ¶sungen fÃ¼r den PC angeboten werden, es sieht halt immer noch wie ein Mobilprodukt aus.
Aber was solls? Optik ist nicht immer alles. 
Das Balancing ist wie imemr noch ziemlich hart und selbst auf Leicht wird man etliche der 2x20 Maps langen Kampagnen einige Male wiederholen mÃ¼ssen, wenn man 3 Sterne haben mÃ¶chte.
Das Gute ist, die braucht man nicht, um alle Steam-Errungenschaften zu erhalten.
So gelangt man ziemlich einfach zu einem 100%-Spielstand, was Sammler erfreuen wird.
Wer lange genug spielt und eisern die Ressorcenpunkte fÃ¼r die Entwicklung aufbewahrt und gezielt fÃ¼r Aufwertungen ausgibt, der wird merken, dass das Spiel dann auf Ã¤lteren Maps plÃ¶tzlich viel einfacher geht und 3 Sterne auch fÃ¼r alle Karten drin sind.
Manchmal ist es auch nur die eigene Strategie, die einem das Leben schwer macht.
Schaut dann einfach mal bei Youtube nach, wie andere Spieler an die Sache herangehen.

Eine Info an alle Meckerer:
Wer hier schlechte Bewertungen zum Spiel wegen der nicht anklickbaren Kampagnen ist: das Spiel bringt immer 2 Kampagnen im Hauptspiel mit + 2 kaufbare DLC Kampagnen.
Die stehen da schon als noch gesperrt drin, wer die nicht kaufen mÃ¶chte, der spart sich das Geld halt, sollte deswegen aber keine schlechte Bewertung abgeben.
Warum auch? Die 2 Hauptkampagnen sind lang genug, wer will, der kann sich dutzende Stunden damit beschÃ¤ftigen, wenn man wirklich alles freischalten will.
Und die 2 Zusatzkampagnen kann man immer mal im Deal dazukaufen.
Das kostet dann fast nichts und bringt verdoppelte normale Spielzeit.
Preis-Leistung ist hier wirklich top und fÃ¼r beide Seiten fair.

So, ich will hier nicht lÃ¤nger schwafeln: einfach kaufen, spielen! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198017415957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3197, 'last_played': 1482674312}
review:
A simple tower defense game.  The artwork is great, and the music is fine.  Gameplay is vanilla tower defense, but the interface is a bit of a mess.  No hotkeys which are a basic requirement for TDs, and navigating between levels is not at all stright-forward or intuitive.  Finally, the game will freeze up if you leave it running.

Update: I have continued to play, and whileI remain disappointed and frustrated with the interface, the game is an enjoyable waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985335852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1468010440}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072429429', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1468521507}
review:
Day-D plays pretty much exactly the same as the Fort Defense game, except instead of pirate ships you're holding back waves of dinosaurs, as the game's name so subtly implies.  The mechanics are similar in both games, so if you liked Fort Defense you might like this one; assuming that is you're not expecting anything radically new or different in terms of gameplay.  The dinosaur mobs are fairly cute though, so if the pirate aesthetic wasn't your thing maybe this would be different.

All in all, it's a fun and relatively simple tower defense game that's good for some laid back gameplay, though I am disappointed you can't refund the points you put into your traits. If you make a poor decision, you're stuck with it. Plan carefully ahead I guess!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007759830', 'num_games_owned': 3051, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1468059926}
review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Bei Day D handelt es sich um ein klassisches Tower Defense Game wie Kingdom Rush oder Island Defense. Man hat verschiedene TÃ¼rme die man verwendet um die Gegner daran zu hindern an einen Zielpunkt zu gelangen. ZusÃ¤tzlich kann man sich fÃ¼r Evolutionspunkte welche man am Levelende erhÃ¤lt oder selten auch mal von einem Gegner gedroppt werden seine tÃ¼rme, Skills und ein paar andere Dinge verbessern.

[h1]Kann man ein und das selbe Spiel mehrfach verkaufen?[/h1]
Der Entwickler Creobit unter dem Publisher 8Floor beweist mal wieder das man ein Spiel sooft Recyceln kann wie man will. Nun zum mitlerweile 4. mal wurde das gleiche Spiel mit einem neuen Skin auf den Markt gebracht.
Erst brachte Creobit das Spiel Royal Defense auf den markt, anschlieÃŸend das Spiel Fort Defense, danach Gnumz: Master of Defense und nun mitlerweile Day D. Alle Spiele laufen Ã¼ber das gleiche System und sehen lediglich vom Design anders aus. Wer also interesse an diesem Spiel hat schaut erstmal ob eines der anderen vll im Sale oder billiger ist denn wenn ihr eines davon gesehen habt kennt ihr alle.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
- LÃ¤uft flÃ¼ssig
- Design/Skin sieht lustig aus
- Viele Level

[h1]Neutrales[/h1]
- FÃ¼r Achievement Hunter sind alle Achievements einfach. Ihr kÃ¶nnt also das SPiel kaufen ca 10% davon durchspielen und liegt bei 100%

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
- Gegner kennen nur 4 Anzeigepositionen dadurch sieht es manchamal aus als wÃ¼rde ein Dino nach recht laufen er lÃ¤uft aber nach rechts oben oder Ã¤hnliches
- Keine Herausforderung, egal welcher Schwierigkeitsgrad das Spiel ist sehr einfach
- Manchmal sind stellen etwas buggy zb konnte ich in 2 Missionen die Felder nicht freikaufen 
- Spiel zu langsam, Ich musste es auf double Speed Spielen und hatte dennoch manchmal den Wunsch es wÃ¼rde noch einen hÃ¶heren Modus geben
- Keine tastaturunterstÃ¼tzung. man kann mit ESC nicht ins MenÃ¼, amn hat keine Shortcuts,... Dies waren schon in den 3 VorgÃ¤ngern Dinge Ã¼ber die sich viele im Forum aufregten und auch nach Jahren bringt Creobit diese Funktion nicht in ihr System.
- Preis fÃ¼r einen neuen Skin einfach zu teuer

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Wer eins gesehen hat kennt alle. Wer bereits ein Spiel der reihe hat braucht hier nicht zuzugreifen ausser er bekommt es in einem 90% Sale. Wer noch keines der Spiele hat und interessiert ist sollte sich einfach das mit dem fÃ¼r sich interessantesten Skin suchen, ansonsten kann ich nur sagen das es sich um einen relativ langweiligen Vertreter des Tower Defense Bereiches handelt und es fÃ¼r den gleichen Preis wesentlich bessere gibt
